intro: Cussonia monophylla, commonly known as the single-leaf arrowroot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in diameter, giving it a striking appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix. Cussonia monophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
